result.execSummary:
The defendant Porfiria G Valcq was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Porfiria G Valcq in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:21 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

BY THE COURT:  Warrant is vacated. 

Atty Drengler states the status of the case. 
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond and conditions of bond are continued. 

Atty Cousins indicates he will be filing a motion for joinder with the co-defendant's case.  Will file the motion today and give a copy to Atty Drengler and Atty Redfield.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Judicial Review Request 11-20-15 az

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:05 AM Court calls case.
Matter is set for a pretrial conference at this time.
Court states appearances.

Defendant is not present.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court, was not sure if his client was to be here or not, may have been some confusion. Defendant may have thought this hearing was not going to be happening for reasons stated by Atty Drengler.

Atty Drengler has been in contact with his client and with the co-defendant, discussing the possibility of obtaining an expert on dog sniffs, requests matter to be scheduled for a status conference in the future, then decide how to proceed further.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, co-defendant's case is set for a jury trial in January, does not want to delay this case on obtaining an expert in another case, prefers to go forward with pretrial.

BY THE COURT:
Court issues warrant for arrest but will not sign it until the end of the business day on Tuesday.

Court addresses the parties.
